channel.title: LED opposite signal
channel.description: HE tehre everybody, i have a real NooB question...I connected dimmed LED's to the LFO,all works great ,but when i dont use the LFO the LED is on and i want it off by no signal, now one friend of me suggested to work with constant integer and the math/== object, this works great but the LED dont dimm anymore and just go on and off..i tried the invert object but didnt do anything either... so my question is ,is there a (easy) way to invert the siganl to the led? at the circel at the right, the LFO's for the filter, i used the way my friend told me,what is working but without dimming greetings Dennis

item.title: LED opposite signal
item.dc:creator: @kashis dennis
item.description:
@kashis wrote:

thanks i will do this as soon i have some time!

Read full topic

item.title: LED opposite signal
item.dc:creator: @philoop
item.description:
@philoop wrote:

You dont have to invert the signal, you have to make a bipolar signal unipolar....so use bipolar2unipolar object.if Led is still on while of i would adjust the phase of the Lfo.

Read full topic

item.title: LED opposite signal
item.dc:creator: @kashis dennis
item.description:
@kashis wrote:

HE tehre everybody,

i have a real NooB question...I connected dimmed LED's to the LFO,all works great ,but when i dont use the LFO the LED is on and i want it off by no signal, now one friend of me suggested to work with constant integer and the math/== object, this works great but the LED dont dimm anymore and just go on and off..i tried the invert object but didnt do anything either...
so my question is ,is there a (easy) way to invert the siganl to the led?

at the circel at the right, the LFO's for the filter, i used the way my friend told me,what is working but without dimming

LED opposite2.png1585x837 238 KB

greetings Dennis
